data.enText: some
some but not all of a thing

data.chText: 我们花了一部分时间在博物馆。
data.enText: We spent part of the time in the museum.

data.chText: 大楼的一部分毁于火灾。
data.enText: Part of the building was destroyed in the fire.

data.chText: 只对选民透露了部分情况。
data.enText: Voters are given only part of the story (= only some of the information) .
Part of me feels sorry for him (= I feel partly, but not entirely, sorry for him) .
piece
a section, piece or feature of sth
The early part of her life was spent in Paris.
The novel is good in parts .

data.chText: 我们已完成了工作的困难部分。
data.enText: We've done the difficult part of the job.

data.chText: 这一程序可以分为两部分。
data.enText: The procedure can be divided into two parts.

data.chText: 最糟糕的是必须在雨中等待三个小时。
data.enText: The worst part was having to wait three hours in the rain.
member
a member of sth; a person or thing that, together with others, makes up a single unit

data.chText: 你必须能作为团队的一员去工作。
data.enText: You need to be able to work as part of a team.
of machine
a piece of a machine or structure
aircraft parts
the working parts of the machinery
spare parts
of body/plant
a separate piece or area of a human or animal body or of a plant
the parts of the body
region/area

data.chText: （世界、国家或城镇等的）区域，地区
data.enText: an area or a region of the world, a country, a town, etc.
the northern part of the country

data.chText: 生长在世界许多地区的一种植物
data.enText: a plant that grows in many parts of the world

data.chText: 你是日本哪个地区的人？
data.enText: Which part of Japan do you come from?

data.chText: 什么时候到我们这个地方来，请来看看我们。
data.enText: Come and visit us if you're ever in our part of the world.
a region or an area
She's not from these parts.
He's just arrived back from foreign parts.
of book/series

data.chText: （书、电视系列片等的、尤指单独发行或播出的）部，集，部分
data.enText: a section of a book, television series, etc., especially one that is published or broadcast separately

data.chText: 每周出版一部分，共分25周出齐的百科全书。
data.enText: an encyclopedia published in 25 weekly parts
Henry IV, Part II

data.chText: 最后一集将于下星期天晚上播出。
data.enText: The final part will be shown next Sunday evening.
for actor
a role played by an actor in a play, film/movie, etc.; the words spoken by an actor in a particular role
She was very good in the part.
Have you learned your part yet?
He's always playing a part (= pretending to be sth that he is not) .
involvement
the way in which sb/sth is involved in an action or situation
He had no part in the decision.
in music
music for a particular voice or instrument in a group singing or playing together
the clarinet part
four-part harmony
equal portion
a unit of measurement that allows you to compare the different amounts of substances in sth

data.chText: 一份水兑上三份葡萄酒。
data.enText: Add three parts wine to one part water.
in hair
the best/better part of sth
most of sth, especially a period of time; more than half of sth

data.chText: 旅程花去了她半个多小时。
data.enText: The journey took her the better part of an hour.
for the most part
mostly; usually

data.chText: 投稿者大多是专业科学家。
data.enText: The contributors are, for the most part, professional scientists.
for my, his, their, etc. part
speaking for myself, etc.
have a part to play (in sth)

data.chText: 能帮助，能在…中发挥作用
data.enText: to be able to help sth

data.chText: 打击犯罪，我们大家都有一份责任。
data.enText: We all have a part to play in the fight against crime.
have/play a part (in sth)
to be involved in sth

data.chText: 她积极参与地方政治活动。
data.enText: She plays an active part in local politics.
have/play/take/want no part in/of sth

data.chText: 不参与，不卷入，拒绝加入（尤指不赞成的事情）
data.enText: to not be involved or refuse to be involved in sth, especially because you disapprove of it

data.chText: 我决不卷入这一卑鄙勾当。
data.enText: I want no part of this sordid business.
in part
partly; to some extent

data.chText: 她的成功在某种程度上是由于运气好。
data.enText: Her success was due in part to luck.
look/dress the part

data.chText: 外貌 / 穿着与工作（或身份、职务）相宜
data.enText: to have an appearance or wear clothes suitable for a particular job, role or position
a man/woman of (many) parts
a person with many skills
on the part of sb/on sb's part
made or done by sb
It was an error on my part.
part and parcel of sth
an essential part of sth
Keeping the accounts is part and parcel of my job.
part of the furniture

data.chText: 见惯了的人（或东西）；存在已久故不为人注意的人（或事物）
data.enText: a person or thing that you are so used to seeing that you no longer notice them

data.chText: 我在那里工作得太久，都不为人注意了。
data.enText: I worked there so long that I became part of the furniture.
take sth in good part

data.chText: 从容面对，不介意地接受（不太愉快的事）
data.enText: to accept sth slightly unpleasant without complaining or being offended
take part (in sth)
to be involved in sth

data.chText: 参加讨论 / 示威 / 战斗 / 庆祝
data.enText: to take part in a discussion/demonstration/fight/celebration

data.chText: 有多少国家参加了上届奥运会？
data.enText: How many countries took part in the last Olympic Games?
take sb's part

data.chText: （在辩论等中）支持某人，站在某人一边
data.enText: to support sb, for example in an argument
His mother always takes his part.
discretion is the better part of valour

data.chText: 谨慎即大勇；慎重为勇敢之本
data.enText: you should avoid danger and not take unnecessary risks

data.id-g-sent: greater/more than the sum of its parts

data.enText: leave sb
if a person parts from another person, or two people part , they leave each other
We parted at the airport.

data.chText: 我不愿分手时关系闹得这么僵。
data.enText: I hate to part on such bad terms.
He has recently parted from his wife (= they have started to live apart) .
keep apart
to prevent sb from being with sb else
I hate being parted from the children.

data.chText: 小狗崽儿一出生就和它们的妈妈分开了。
data.enText: The puppies were parted from their mother at birth.
move away
if two things or parts of things part or you part them, they move away from each other

data.chText: 人群在他们面前分开了。
data.enText: The crowd parted in front of them.

data.chText: 电梯门打开了，总统从里面步出。
data.enText: The elevator doors parted and out stepped the President.
Her lips were slightly parted.

data.chText: 她略扒开窗帘，向外张望。
data.enText: She parted the curtains a little and looked out.
hair
to divide your hair into two sections with a comb , creating a line that goes from the back of your head to the front
He parts his hair in the middle.
part company (with/from sb)
to leave sb; to end a relationship with sb

data.chText: 这就是我们分手的地方。
data.enText: This is where we part company (= go in different directions) .

data.chText: 乐队与其经理已散伙了。
data.enText: The band have parted company with their manager.

data.chText: 乐队与其经理已散伙了。
data.enText: The band and their manager have parted company.
to disagree with sb about sth

data.chText: 韦伯与马克思在若干重大问题上意见有分歧。
data.enText: Weber parted company with Marx on a number of important issues.
a fool and his money are soon parted

data.chText: 傻瓜口袋漏，有钱留不住；蠢人不积财
data.enText: a person who is not sensible usually spends money too quickly or carelessly, or is cheated by others
part with sth

data.chText: 放弃，交出（尤指不舍得的东西）
data.enText: to give sth to sb else, especially sth that you would prefer to keep

data.chText: 一定要注意先看清合约再交钱。
data.enText: Make sure you read the contract before parting with any money.

data.chText: 由两部分构成；在一定程度上；部分地
data.enText: consisting of two things; to some extent but not completely
She's part French, part English.
His feelings were part anger, part relief.

data.chText: 这个课程是欧洲委员会部分资助的。
data.enText: The course is part funded by the European Commission.

data.chText: 他拥有法国某农场的一部分。
data.enText: He is part owner of a farm in France.

ex.chText: 他的车的前部已经清洗过了。
ex.enText: The front part of his car was washed.

ex.chText: 在该国的部分地区，人们至少会说两种语言。
ex.enText: In parts of that country, people can speak at least two languages.

ex.chText: 部分利润将捐给慈善机构。
ex.enText: Part of the profit will be donated to charity.

ex.chText: 假期里最开心的事情就是滑雪。
ex.enText: The best part of the holiday was the skiing.

synonyms.bx: 最普通用词，指物体、地区、事件、时间等的一部分或特征之一。

ex.chText: 警方找到了几片陶器碎片。
ex.enText: Police found several fragments of broken pottery.

ex.chText: 我听到了他们谈话的片段。
ex.enText: I heard a fragment of their conversation.

synonyms.bx: 指从较大物体上断裂或脱落的小块碎片，或谈话、新闻等的片段。

ex.chText: 桥的前段坍塌了。
ex.enText: The front portion of the bridge collapsed.

ex.chText: 很大一部分财产归了约翰。
ex.enText: A large portion of the property went to John.

ex.chText: 食物的花费只占预算的一小部分。
ex.enText: Only a small portion of the budget was spent on food.

synonyms.bx: 尤指某事物中可与其他部分区分开来的部分。

ex.chText: 乘客只能在吸烟区吸烟。
ex.enText: Passengers are allowed to smoke only in the smoking section.

ex.chText: 交通繁忙的路段配备了两名交警。
ex.enText: There are two traffic police in the busy section of road.

ex.chText: 他们订购的家具是分装运送的。
ex.enText: The furniture they ordered was transported to them in sections.

synonyms.bx: 指物体、地方等划分出的部分，也可指结构、家具等整体中的部分。

ex.chText: 请将批阅完的考卷按及格和不及格分开。
ex.enText: Please separate the marked examination papers into passes and fails.

ex.chText: 这两个社区被一条狭窄的街道隔开。
ex.enText: The two communities are separated by a narrow street.

ex.chText: 她把4个鸡蛋的蛋清和蛋黄分开。
ex.enText: She separated the whites and yolks of 4 eggs.

synonyms.bx: 指将混合物按不同类别分开，也指把紧连在一起或溶合在一起的东西分开。

ex.chText: 这条河把我的果园和他的果园隔开了。
ex.enText: The river divides my orchard from his.

ex.chText: 这个苹果被分成了4等份。
ex.enText: This cake is divided into four equal parts.

ex.chText: 老师把全班分成5个小组。
ex.enText: The teacher divided the class into five groups.

synonyms.bx: 指把两个区域分隔开，或将一个整体分为若干部分，有时含平均划分之意。

ex.chText: 把道德责任和政治责任分隔开来是错误的。
ex.enText: It is wrong to isolate moral responsibility from political responsibility.

ex.chText: 这个村子因洪水而与外界隔绝。
ex.enText: The village was isolated by the flood.

ex.chText: 传染病患者应予以隔离。
ex.enText: People with contagious diseases should be isolated.

ex.chText: 执政党内的激进派坚持主张从政治上孤立该国。
ex.enText: The radical group in the ruling party insisted upon isolating the country politically.

synonyms.bx: 指区别看待问题、观点等，也指使人或物处于孤立、隔离的状态。

ex.chText: 她从中间把头发分开。
ex.enText: She parts her hair in the middle.

ex.chText: 人群分开让警车通过。
ex.enText: The crowd parted to let the police car through.

ex.chText: 她不愿和孩子们分离。
ex.enText: She hated being parted from the children.

ex.chText: 她和丈夫已经分居了。
ex.enText: She has parted from her husband.

synonyms.bx: 多指使紧密相连的人或物分开，指父母和子女分开时多用被动语态。

data.enText: the best/better part of sth
most of sth, especially a period of time; more than half of sth

data.chText: 旅程花去了她半个多小时。
data.enText: The journey took her the better part of an hour.
for the most part
mostly; usually

data.chText: 投稿者大多是专业科学家。
data.enText: The contributors are, for the most part, professional scientists.
for my, his, their, etc. part
speaking for myself, etc.
have a part to play (in sth)

data.chText: 能帮助，能在…中发挥作用
data.enText: to be able to help sth

data.chText: 打击犯罪，我们大家都有一份责任。
data.enText: We all have a part to play in the fight against crime.
have/play a part (in sth)
to be involved in sth

data.chText: 她积极参与地方政治活动。
data.enText: She plays an active part in local politics.

data.chText: 不参与，不卷入，拒绝加入（尤指不赞成的事情）
data.enText: to not be involved or refuse to be involved in sth, especially because you disapprove of it

data.chText: 我决不卷入这一卑鄙勾当。
data.enText: I want no part of this sordid business.
in part
partly; to some extent

data.chText: 她的成功在某种程度上是由于运气好。
data.enText: Her success was due in part to luck.
look/dress the part

data.chText: 外貌 / 穿着与工作（或身份、职务）相宜
data.enText: to have an appearance or wear clothes suitable for a particular job, role or position
a man/woman of (many) parts
a person with many skills
on the part of sb/on sb's part
made or done by sb
It was an error on my part.
part and parcel of sth
an essential part of sth
Keeping the accounts is part and parcel of my job.
part of the furniture

data.chText: 见惯了的人（或东西）；存在已久故不为人注意的人（或事物）
data.enText: a person or thing that you are so used to seeing that you no longer notice them

data.chText: 我在那里工作得太久，都不为人注意了。
data.enText: I worked there so long that I became part of the furniture.
take sth in good part

data.chText: 从容面对，不介意地接受（不太愉快的事）
data.enText: to accept sth slightly unpleasant without complaining or being offended
take part (in sth)

data.chText: 参加讨论 / 示威 / 战斗 / 庆祝
data.enText: to take part in a discussion/demonstration/fight/celebration

data.chText: 有多少国家参加了上届奥运会？
data.enText: How many countries took part in the last Olympic Games?
take sb's part

data.chText: （在辩论等中）支持某人，站在某人一边
data.enText: to support sb, for example in an argument
His mother always takes his part.
discretion is the better part of valour

data.chText: 谨慎即大勇；慎重为勇敢之本
data.enText: you should avoid danger and not take unnecessary risks
in large part
in large measure
to a great extent

data.chText: 他们的成功在很大程度上应归功于他们的决心。
data.enText: Their success is due in large part to their determination.
be greater/more than the sum of its parts

data.chText: 个体相加不如集体的力量大
data.enText: to be better or more effective as a group than you would think just by looking at the individual members of the group
part company (with/from sb)
to leave sb; to end a relationship with sb

data.chText: 这就是我们分手的地方。
data.enText: This is where we part company (= go in different directions) .

data.chText: 乐队与其经理已散伙了。
data.enText: The band have parted company with their manager.

data.chText: 乐队与其经理已散伙了。
data.enText: The band and their manager have parted company.
to disagree with sb about sth

data.chText: 韦伯与马克思在若干重大问题上意见有分歧。
data.enText: Weber parted company with Marx on a number of important issues.
a fool and his money are soon parted

data.chText: 傻瓜口袋漏，有钱留不住；蠢人不积财
data.enText: a person who is not sensible usually spends money too quickly or carelessly, or is cheated by others
part with sth

data.chText: 放弃，交出（尤指不舍得的东西）
data.enText: to give sth to sb else, especially sth that you would prefer to keep

data.chText: 一定要注意先看清合约再交钱。
data.enText: Make sure you read the contract before parting with any money.

trans: 放弃，交出，卖掉（贵重物品或难舍之物）

tr: the actions and activities assigned to or required or expected of a person or group
example: the function of a teacher
the government must do its part
play its role

tr: the part played by a person in bringing about a result
example: I am proud of my contribution in advancing the project
they all did their share of the work

tr: something less than the whole of a human artifact
example: the rear part of the house
glue the two parts together

tr: a line of scalp that can be seen when sections of hair are combed in opposite directions
example: his part was right in the middle

tr: that which concerns a person with regard to a particular role or situation
example: it requires vigilance on our part
they resisted every effort on his part

tr: one of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole
example: the written part of the exam
the finance section of the company
the BBC's engineering division

tr: an actor's portrayal of someone in a play
example: she played the part of Desdemona

tr: the melody carried by a particular voice or instrument in polyphonic music
example: he tried to sing the tenor part

tr: the extended spatial location of something
example: the farming regions of France
religions in all parts of the world
regions of outer space

tr: a portion of a natural object
example: they analyzed the river into three parts
he needed a piece of granite

tr: assets belonging to or due to or contributed by an individual person or group
example: he wanted his share in cash

tr: something determined in relation to something that includes it
example: he wanted to feel a part of something bigger than himself
I read a portion of the manuscript
the smaller component is hard to reach
the animal constituent of plankton

tr: force, take, or pull apart
example: He separated the fighting children
Moses parted the Red Sea

tr: come apart
example: The two pieces that we had glued separated

tr: leave
example: The family took off for Florida

tr: go one's own way
move apart
example: The friends separated after the party

tr: discontinue an association or relation
go different ways
example: The business partners broke over a tax question
The couple separated after 25 years of marriage
My friend and I split up

tr: in part
in some degree
not wholly
example: I felt partly to blame
He was partially paralyzed

value.def: A part of something is one of the pieces, sections, or elements that it consists of.

example.ex: I like that part of Cape Town...
example.tran: 我喜欢开普敦的那片地方。

example.ex: Respect is a very important part of any relationship.
example.tran: 尊重是任何关系中都非常重要的部分。

value.def: A part for a machine or vehicle is one of the smaller pieces that is used to make it.

example.ex: ...spare parts for military equipment...
example.tran: 军事装备的备用零件

example.ex: This engine has only got three moving parts.
example.tran: 这台发动机只有3个活动部件。

value.def: Part of something is some of it.

example.ex: It was a very severe accident and he lost part of his foot...
example.tran: 那是一场非常严重的事故，他有一只脚残废了。

example.ex: Mum and he were able to walk part of the way together...
example.tran: 妈妈和他能够一起走一段路。

example.ex: Woodhead spent part of his childhood in Rhodesia.
example.tran: 伍德黑德在罗得西亚度过了部分童年时光。

value.def: If you say that something is part one thing, part another, you mean that it is to some extent the first thing and to some extent the second thing.

example.ex: The television producer today has to be part news person, part educator...
example.tran: 今天的电视制片人必须既是新闻人，又是教育者。

example.ex: Several people looked over the part-Jacobean, part-Georgian building.
example.tran: 几个人查看了那栋半詹姆士一世时期风格、半乔治王朝风格的大楼。

value.def: You can use part when you are talking about the proportions of substances in a mixture. For example, if you are told to use five parts water to one part paint, the mixture should contain five times as much water as paint.

example.ex: Use turpentine and linseed oil, three parts to two.
example.tran: 用松节油和亚麻油，比例为3:2。

value.def: A part in a play or film is one of the roles in it which an actor or actress can perform.

example.ex: Alf Sjoberg offered her a large part in the play he was directing...
example.tran: 阿尔夫·肖博格让她在其导演的戏中扮演重要角色。

example.ex: He was just right for the part.
example.tran: 他是那个角色的不二人选。

value.def: Your part in something that happens is your involvement in it.

example.ex: If only he could conceal his part in the accident...
example.tran: 要是他能够隐瞒住自己在这场事故中的责任就好了。

example.ex: He felt a sense of relief that his part in this business was now over.
example.tran: 现在不再参与这门生意了，他如释重负。

value.def: If something or someone is part of a group or organization, they belong to it or are included in it.

example.ex: ...voting on whether to remain part of the Union or become independent...
example.tran: 决定是留在联盟内还是独立的投票

example.ex: I was a part of the team and wanted to remain a part of the team.
example.tran: 我是队伍的一员，希望留在这个队伍中。

value.def: The part in someone's hair is the line running from the front to the back of their head where their hair lies in different directions.

example.ex: The straight white part in her ebony hair seemed to divide the back of her head in half.
example.tran: 她乌黑的头发中有条笔直的白色分缝，仿佛将她的后脑勺一分为二。

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 parting

value.def: If something or someone plays a large or important part in an event or situation, they are very involved in it and have an important effect on what happens.

example.ex: These days work plays an important part in a single woman's life...
example.tran: 现在，工作在单身女性的生活中起着重要作用。

example.ex: We believe she may have played a part in hiding the cash.
example.tran: 我们认为她可能参与了藏匿现金。

value.def: If you take part in an activity, you do it together with other people.

example.ex: Thousands of students have taken part in demonstrations.
example.tran: 数千学生参加了游行。

value.def: If you say that you want no part of something, you mean that you do not want to be involved in it at all.

example.ex: What some other clubs do is unfortunate, but we want no part of it.
example.tran: 其他一些俱乐部的所作所为令人遗憾，但是我们不愿介入。

value.def: When you are describing people's thoughts or actions, you can say for her part or for my part, for example, to introduce what a particular person thinks or does.

example.ex: For my part, I feel elated and close to tears...
example.tran: 就我而言，我感到非常高兴，都快落泪了。

example.ex: The soldiers, for their part, agreed not to disrupt the election campaign.
example.tran: 就士兵们而言，他们答应不去干扰竞选活动。

value.tran: 在（某人）看来；就（某人）而言

value.def: If you talk about a feeling or action on someone's part, you are referring to something that they feel or do.

example.ex: ...techniques on their part to keep us from knowing exactly what's going on...
example.tran: 他们所采取的防止我们知道具体发生什么事情的手段

example.ex: There is no need for any further instructions on my part...
example.tran: 我没有必要再作进一步的指导。

example.ex: There have been numerous instances of excessive force on the part of security police.
example.tran: 治安警察滥用武力的实例不胜枚举。

value.def: For the most part means mostly or usually.

example.ex: For the most part the Germans kept out of local disputes...
example.tran: 德国人通常不卷入地区冲突。

example.ex: Professors, for the most part, are firmly committed to teaching, not research.
example.tran: 大多数教授都投身于教学，而不是研究。

value.def: You use in part to indicate that something exists or happens to some extent but not completely.

example.ex: The levels of blood glucose depend in part on what you eat and when you eat...
example.tran: 血糖水平在某种程度上取决于饮食内容和时间。

example.ex: In part this attitude was due to fear of trade union and employee reactions.
example.tran: 在某种程度上，这一态度是由于害怕工会和雇员的反应。

value.def: If you say that something happened for the best part or the better part of a period of time, you mean that it happened for most of that time.

example.ex: He had been in Israel for the best part of twenty-four hours...
example.tran: 他一天24小时多数时间在以色列。

example.ex: We spent the better part of an hour searching for her.
example.tran: 我们花了近1个小时找她。

menus.item: NOUN USES, QUANTIFIER USES, AND PHRASES
menus.tran: 名词用法、量词用法及短语

value.def: If things that are next to each other part or if you part them, they move in opposite directions, so that there is a space between them.

example.ex: Her lips parted as if she were about to take a deep breath...
example.tran: 她张开嘴，好像要深呼吸。

example.ex: He crossed to the window of the sitting-room and parted the curtains.
example.tran: 他走到客厅窗户边，拉开了窗帘。

value.def: If you part your hair in the middle or at one side, you make it lie in two different directions so that there is a straight line running from the front of your head to the back.

example.ex: Picking up a brush, Joanna parted her hair...
example.tran: 乔安娜拿起一把刷子，给头发分缝。

example.ex: His hair was slicked back and neatly parted.
example.tran: 他梳着锃亮的大背头，缝分得很整齐。

value.def: When two people part, or if one person parts from another, they leave each other.

example.ex: He gave me the envelope and we parted...
example.tran: 他给了我那个信封，我们就告别了。

example.ex: He has confirmed he is parting from his Swedish-born wife Eva.
example.tran: 他承认要与他的瑞典妻子伊娃分手。

value.def: If you are parted from someone you love, you are prevented from being with them.

example.ex: I don't believe Lotte and I will ever be parted...
example.tran: 我相信洛特和我永远都不会分开。

example.ex: A stay in hospital may be the first time a child is ever parted from its parents.
example.tran: 住院可能是孩子第一次与父母分开。

trans: 积分部分；整数部份；主要的部分
主体；主体部分；主要部分；主要部件；主件
